key_points: Twitter banned Donald Trump, followed by other platforms banning Trump-related content.
A significant number of right-leaning accounts were also removed across various platforms.
Big Tech's actions demonstrated their power and raised concerns about freedom of speech.
There's a debate over whether Trump's actions warranted such a response from tech companies.
The article questions if a double standard is applied regarding who gets banned or censored.
Section 230 is criticized for giving too much protection to Big Tech companies.
The actions of Big Tech are seen as a threat to free speech and independent thought.
The ability to express oneself or do business online is increasingly tied to agreeing with Big Tech leaders.
The crackdown is viewed as not only against Trump but broader conservative speech.
The author argues for the accountability of tech companies to ensure a free society.
